results.title: Lumiere programme [Silent version]
results.brief_description: The first public film show in Great Britain was given at the Regent Street Polytechnic London, on February 20th, 1896, by the brothers August and Louis Lumiere. This film is a complete reprint of the programs shown on that occasion. It comprises the following subjects: Workers leaving the Lumiere factory; Baby at the lunch table; Demolition of a wall; Watering the gardener; Congress of Photographic Societies at Neuville-Sur-Saone, July 1895; Arrival of a train at Ciotat Station; A game of cards; A boat leaving harbour. None of these films is more than a single shot, without cutting or camera movement; their interest lay entirely in the novelty of the moving photograph.

results.title: Lumiere programme

None of these films is more than a single shot, without cutting or camera movement; their interest lay entirely in the novelty of the moving photograph. This version includes a piano accompaniment and narration which was added in 1956.

results.title: Lumiere
results.brief_description:
Compilation film based on reels shot by the brothers Lumiere and their staff. It contains street scenes and public events: cruise on the Seine, the lift of the Eiffel Tower, a visit of Czar Nicholas II to Paris in 1896. Those scenes are the earliest sights of Paris ever recorded on film

Credits: Producer, Pierre Braunberger ; director, Marc Allegret ; music, Henri Sauguet.

results.title: Lumaaq: an Eskimo legend [French version] = Lumaaq: une legende esquimo
results.creator_credit: Pierre Moretti, ONF | NFB and Co Hoedeman
results.brief_description: Lumaaq tells the story of a legend widely believed by the Povungnituk Innuit. The artist’s drawings are transferred to paper, cut out and animated under the camera. The result is Innuit prints in action. Dialogue, music and artwork make this film a total cultural transplant. Sound film without commentary.

results.title: Luke's Party
results.brief_description: A young woman sits herself in front of a video camera to document her struggles as a single mother. By the time she has finished dealing with her bills, her children’s demands, her best friend’s questions and trying to arrange her son’s birthday, we understand only too well how difficult life can be. A very funny and very affectionate look at working class urban life.

results.title: Ludovic: visiting Grandpa
results.creator_credit: Jean-Jacques Leduc, ONF | NFB and Co Hoedeman
results.brief_description: Ludovic spends the afternoon with Grandpa on the farm, tending the animals and the garden. Ludovic and his grandfather both miss grandma very much. Although she’s gone, her magic is still around. Direction, animation, script and camera work by Co Hoedeman.

results.title: Ludovic: the snow gift
results.creator_credit: Therese Descary, ONF | NFB, French Program Animation and Youth Studio Program
results.brief_description: Ludovic, a young teddy bear who lives in a thatched cottage with his family watches the snow outside and dreams of tobogganing with his friends. His parents tell him he is too little, and Ludovic feels lonely, so he invents wonderful games to share with his new found friend, a doll that came to life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Therese Descary, ONF | NFB, French Program Animation and Youth Studio Program

results.title: Ludovic: magic in the air
results.creator_credit: Jean-Jacques Leduc, ONF | NFB and Co Hoedeman
results.brief_description: From the much loved series for young children Ludovic, ‘Magic in the air’, tells a story with puppet animation about the magic of new friends. Ludovic happily plays in the playground when another teddy tries to befriend him, or so he thinks until he is knocked to the ground. Ludovic is rescued by a smiling girl teddy. Suddenly their is magic in the air and Ludovic and his new friend find ways to out-smart the bully. The leaves, the trees and even the sand castle help out and soon the bully leaves him alone. But the magic doesn’t stop and soon magic is used to help cheer up the mad and sad bully. Co Hoedeman who animated, directed and co-wrote this animation blends love with wonderment to create an affectionate story about friendship for kids of all ages. Website Link: www.nfbkids.ca/ludovic

results.title: Ludovic: a crocodile in my garden
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, French Program, Animation Youth Studies, Therese Descary, Jean-Jacques Leduc and Co Hoedeman
results.brief_description: Ludovic, a young teddy bear organises his origami jungle animals to go on a spring picnic in his garden. The mood degenerates as the animals disobey Ludovic and fight one another. Ludovic retreats inside disappointed, but all is resolved happily when cookies are distributed and the animals learn to share.
